meanings.definition: To surpass in boldness or shamelessness.
meanings.sent1: She outbrazened all her classmates by speaking up in front of the whole school.
meanings.sent2: The thief outbrazened the security guards by walking out of the store with stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbrazened the birds by stealing their food right in front of them.
meanings.sent4: The politician outbrazened his opponents by making outrageous claims during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The young artist outbrazened criticism and continued to showcase her unique style.

meanings.definition: To act with audacity or defiance.
meanings.sent1: Despite the warnings, he outbrazened the rules and went swimming in the forbidden lake.
meanings.sent2: The protestors outbrazened the authorities by refusing to disperse from the public square.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbrazened the dog by stealing its favorite toy and parading around with it.
meanings.sent4: She outbrazened her fears and stood up to the bully in front of the whole school.
meanings.sent5: The young boy outbrazened his shyness and performed confidently in the school play.

meanings.sent1: The celebrity outbrazened the paparazzi by posing for photos even after being asked to stop.
meanings.sent2: The student outbrazened the teacher by talking back in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon outbrazened the homeowners by rummaging through the trash cans every night.
meanings.sent4: The toddler outbrazened his parents by throwing a tantrum in the middle of the store.
meanings.sent5: The politician outbrazened the public by denying any wrongdoing despite clear evidence.
